lines.text: we too must be close to our Sun. We too must consecrate our lives to our Sun, and the Sun that shines for us is Adolf Hitler. Attention! You will repeat after me the oath of allegiance to our Fuehrer! "I consecrate my life to Hitler."
"I am ready to sacrifice my life for Hitler."
"I am ready to die for Hitler."

[to Smith]
We're building a new Germany, a strong Germany. There is no room for the sick and the weak and the disabled!

[to the Nazi Major]
No wonder you take away the breath of life so readily. The breath of death is already upon you.

[Haughtily]
I don't give it to strangers.
Franz, how can you stand it - you of all people. How can you be so complacent?
My friend, you can get off a train before it starts or after it stops, but while it is in motion, I wouldn't advise it.
You're a German. If you'd only give our way of living a chance.
You can't give evil and rottenes a fair chance.

[Narration]
That was the last we saw of Carl for a long time. He was swept up in the storm - the storm that was sweeping through all of Germany.

[to Anna]
Blood runs to blood, and German blood runs deep.
